revised_title: The Role and Function of the Royal Society in Publishing Philosophical Transactions
tldr: The Royal Society's Committee clarifies the role and function of the Philosophical Transactions, explaining that the Society does not endorse or approve the content of the published papers, but rather selects papers based on their importance and singularity. They emphasize that the Society does not give opinions on subjects and that thanks given to authors are a matter of civility.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Scientific Communication
